thread.title: It is interesting going back to read the 1st 15 pages of this thread
thread.title_full: It is interesting going back to read the 1st 15 pages of this thread

author: AZ Native
title: It is interesting going back to read the 1st 15 pages of this thread
text: It is interesting going back to read the 1st 15 pages of this thread Gameday thread Cardinals at Lions 10-11-15 Worse than the first 15 minutes of the game? Originally Posted by AZ Native Gameday thread Cardinals at Lions 10-11-15 I did not read it. I know I was not happy with the start of the game. Location: Bullhead City, AZ Posts: 25,488 When you lose a game like we did to the Rams where we made so many mistakes and then start the next game flat and looking bad it brings concern to the fans. Thanks goodness the team woke up and got things working. -"The Cardinals will not cause the Cardinals to lose" - Arians 1-18-13 When theyre patting you on the back , theyre looking for a soft spot where to stick the knife - Arians 9-24-15 Location: In A Cigar Bar Near You Age: 55 Posts: 7,651 To me it was no different then any other game day thread. There are the usual suspects that only come in in when things are rough. They disappeared quickly after the turn overs began, and we turned the score around. Posts: 1,988 It's straight bandwagon. Start a game with two punts and it's fire everyone and this guy is wasted draft pick that guy can't play. Our front office is horrible our coaches don't know how to coach. Sometimes it's just like Really...Really ASFN Consultant and Senior Writer I thought mine was fairly on target Quote: I'll take the Cards 31-10...Domination. Location: Bullhead City, AZ Posts: 25,488 We go into Pittsburgh this week and we can't afford to start out slow, make mistakes and not take advantage of their mistakes. True test coming up. Will the team be totally focused? -"The Cardinals will not cause the Cardinals to lose" - Arians 1-18-13 When theyre patting you on the back , theyre looking for a soft spot where to stick the knife - Arians 9-24-15 I thought mine was fairly on target +1 Location: San Antonio, Texas Posts: 14,164 Well, the last thing that thread did was reveal bandwagon fans because the way the Cardinals offense was playing in the beginning was no different than over a decade ago when it was 'the same ol' Cards. A bandwagon would not have watched this team long enough to have that gut wrenching feeling lol We Need a Lightning Strike! Posts: 23,991 LMAO...bandwagon fans of Cards? On this board? MASSIE does blow, Powers has been toyed with the past few weeks and Minter is a one dimensional player. I don't care if it's the first 15 or last 15.
